title: 15 Flatbread Recipes to Elevate Your Snack Game
text: 15 Fantastic Flatbread Recipes for Snacking, Entertaining, and Light Meals Let versatile flatbread be the base for a delicious array of toppings and fillings. By Jodie Kautzmann Jodie Kautzmann Jodie Kautzmann is an editor, baker, and confectioner with more than 15 years of experience in content creation, recipe development, and pastry production. She's obsessed with the fine details and ingredients that take dishes from tasty to outright otherworldly. Food & Wine's Editorial Guidelines Published on February 1, 2026 SAVE ALL RECIPES NEW! Save as a collection on MyRecipes Close Credit: Victor Protasio / Food Styling by Chelsea Zimmer / Prop Styling by Claire Spollen Flatbreads have a place in cuisines around the world, and there’s no shortage of ways to enjoy them. They’re perfect for sopping up saucy mains, wrapping around fillings burrito-style, or piling high with toppings like pizza to make a snack, appetizer, or easy meal. Here, we’re leaning into those more substantial options, with recipes that let flatbread shine as the base — featuring from-scratch breads like focaccia with caramelized onion and potato alongside clever shortcuts that start with store-bought flatbread, including a hot honey–carrot version. There’s even a chocolate-cherry dessert flatbread in the mix. Scroll on for plenty of ways to put flatbread on the menu. Love these recipes? With MyRecipes, your personal home for recipes, easily save and organize your favorites, plus thousands more, in one convenient place. 01 of 15 Mushroom Flatbread with White Miso Victor Protasio / Food Styling by Chelsea Zimmer / Prop Styling by Christine Keely Top store-bought flatbread with a miso-cream sauce, oven-roasted mushrooms, and fresh arugula for a snack that’s fast, easy, and special enough for impromptu entertaining. Get the Recipe Save 02 of 15 Hot Honey–Carrot Flatbreads with Basil Chermoula Photo by Victor Protasio / Food Styling by Chelsea Zimmer / Prop Styling by Lydia Pursell Sweet-spicy honey-glazed roasted carrots are served atop ricotta-smeared naan and drizzled with bright basil chermoula for chef Suzanne Cupps' fresh, zingy appetizer. The chermoula can be prepared a couple days ahead of time, but is just as easily made while the carrots are roasting. Get the Recipe Save 03 of 15 Grilled Vegetable Flatbread with Smoked Almond Muhammara Victor Protasio / Food Styling by Chelsea Zimmer / Prop Styling by Claire Spollen This summery showstopper combines grilled zucchini, peppers, and squash on sangak, a gigantic Persian flatbread. The vegetables are marinated after grilling, which gives you time to whip up the smoky, tangy muhammara and grill the sangak until golden. Get the Recipe Save 04 of 15 Potato-Stuffed Kulcha Matt Taylor-Gross / Food Styling by Barrett Washburne Filled with a fragrant mix of spiced mashed potatoes with onion, cilantro, and grated paneer, these naan-adjacent flatbreads from Maneet Chauhan can either be charred under the broiler or seared on the stovetop. Get the Recipe Save 05 of 15 Tomato Flatbread Victor Protasio / Food Styling by Chelsea Zimmer / Prop Styling by Claire Spollen Topped with a zesty zhoug, bresaola, cherry tomatoes, and arugula, this light, bright meal is easy to prepare thanks to store-bought flatbread. Plus, you can customize by swapping in prosciutto or drizzling with hot honey. Get the Recipe Save 06 of 15 Stuffed Parathas Matt Taylor-Gross / Food Styling Barrett Washburne These buttery, flaky whole-wheat Indian flatbreads are filled with your choice of gingery spiced carrots or smashed peas, though you could certainly leave them plain. They're cooked in ghee on the griddle; serve them with yogurt or raita and Indian pickles, or with chutney. Get the Recipe Save 07 of 15 Asparagus Pide Victor Protasio / Food Styling by Margaret Monroe Dickey / Prop Styling by Thom Driver Chef Loryn Nalic of Balkan Treat Box in St. Louis fills these fluffy, lightly charred flatbreads with a blended cheese spread and tender Aleppo pepper-spiced asparagus. Once they come out of the oven, the pides get a dollop each of smoky ajvar and tangy cream, plus a shower of fresh herbs. Get the Recipe Save 08 of 15 Zucchini, Corn, and Shrimp Flatbread Antonis Achilleos / Food Styling by Chelsea Zimmer / Prop Styling by Thom Driver Grill store-bought naan and heap summer's bounty on top: sweet corn, tender shrimp, fresh mascarpone cheese, and delicate ribbons of zucchini. Don't forget the smoked paprika, which helps enhance this dish's smoky flavor. Get the Recipe Save 09 of 15 Spicy Merguez Scramble with Lemon-Harissa Yogurt and Moroccan M'smen Victor Protasio M’smen — an intensely buttery Moroccan flatbread — is the foundation for all kinds of tasty meals. "It’s the ideal vehicle for almost any dip and a gorgeous base on which to pile a salad or braised vegetables and meat," says Gail Simmons. "Crisped up in a pan with a little (more) butter or oil, my most recent m’smen revelation is for breakfast, served with harissa-spiced yogurt, merguez sausage, and eggs." Get the Recipe Save 10 of 15 Caramelized Onion and Potato Focaccia Food & Wine / Photo by Jen Causey / Food Styling by Chelsea Zimmer / Prop Styling by Lydia Pursell Deeply caramelized Spanish onions, thinly sliced fingerling potatoes, fresh thyme, and buttery robiola cheese top pastry chef Claudia Fleming's soft focaccia for a savory bake that's perfect for sharing — the recipe makes four 8-inch flatbreads. Get the Recipe Save 11 of 15 Arepas with Black Beans and Cheese Food & Wine / Photo by Jen Causey / Food Styling by Chelsea Zimmer / Prop Styling by Lydia Purcell Arepas are popular in Colombia and Venezuela; once you make this recipe, we're pretty sure they'll be popular at your house, too. Griddled corn flatbreads are stuffed with salty queso, aromatic black beans, and salsa or pico de gallo for a dish that hits the spot any time of day. Get the Recipe Save 12 of 15 Fig and Prosciutto Flatbreads © Quentin Bacon Prepared with homemade or store-bought pizza dough, this flatbread from 1990 F&W Best New Chef Todd English is topped with sticky-sweet fig jam, pungent Gorgonzola cheese, and salty prosciutto, then garnished with sliced scallion. Get the Recipe Save 13 of 15 Chocolate-Cherry Focaccia Christopher Testani / Food Styling by Margaret Monroe Dickey / Prop Styling by Christine Keely Tart dried cherries and bittersweet chocolate are folded into a cocoa-inflected dough adorned with fresh rosemary, fruity olive oil, turbinado sugar, and flaky sea salt. Once the bread emerges from the oven, more chocolate is strewn over the top; a dusting of powdered sugar makes it ready to be served alongside cherry balsamic for dipping. Get the Recipe Save 14 of 15 White Bean Flatbreads with Prosciutto and Cheese © Christina Holmes Pocketless pitas are a great base for loaded single-serving flatbreads. Brushed in olive oil and browned on the stovetop, they're spread with a mash of canned cannellini beans and prosciutto, topped with roasted almonds and Fontina, then sent to the broiler for a golden finish. Get the Recipe Save 15 of 15 Rosemary Flatbread with Blue Cheese, Grapes, and Honey © Dana Gallagher Sweet grapes and a drizzle of honey balance pungent blue cheese atop a chewy, crusty flatbread laced with fresh rosemary in this sophisticated appetizer from chef David Page and his wife, Barbara Shinn.
